vriforecasting 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Model fitting and producing short-term forecasts using weekly data

    Filter weekly phrdw data filtered by disease type, date, age

    get_weekly_phrdw_by_type_date_age.Rd

    get_weekly_phrdw_by_type_date_age() filter the weekly phrdw data by a given disease type, date range, and age range, it performs the following steps:

    1. Filters the weekly phrdw data by the given epiweek date range and age range.

    2. Aggregates the confirmed cases count by the epiweek date.

    3. Selects the date & the corresponding disease type column.

    4. Renames the disease type as confirm.

    The input dataframe weekly_phrdw_data must be the output of get_weekly_phrdw().

    The input disease type must be either 'sars_cov2', 'rsv', 'flu_a', or 'flu_b'.

    The input start date must be earlier than the input end date.

    The input start age must be earlier than the input end age.

    get_weekly_phrdw_by_type_date_age(
  weekly_phrdw_data,
  type,
  start_date,
  end_date,
  start_age = 0,
  end_age = 150
)

    Arguments

    weekly_phrdw_data

    weekly phrdw data from get_weekly_phrdw(phrdw_flu_daily_count)

    type

    disease type (e.g. 'sars_cov2', 'rsv', 'flu_a', 'flu_b')

    start_date

    start date string (e.g. '2022-01-01')

    end_date

    end date string (e.g. '2022-12-31')

    start_age

    start age integer (default = 0)

    end_age

    end age integer (default = 150)

    Value

    A weekly phrdw data filtered by disease type, date, age

    See also

    get_weekly_phrdw() which produces the input dataframe of this function.

    Examples

    phrdw_data <- data.frame(
 lis_date_collection = as.Date(c('2022-10-02', '2022-10-02',
                                 '2022-10-09', '2022-10-09',
                                 '2022-10-16', '2022-10-16',
                                 '2022-10-23', '2022-10-23',
                                 '2022-10-30', '2022-10-30')),
 result_lab_name = c('BC Centre for Disease Control','BC Centre for Disease Control',
                     'BC Centre for Disease Control','BC Centre for Disease Control',
                     'BC Centre for Disease Control','BC Centre for Disease Control',
                     'BC Centre for Disease Control','BC Centre for Disease Control',
                     'BC Centre for Disease Control','BC Centre for Disease Control'),
 age_years = c(7,8,7,8,7,8,7,8,7,8),
 sars_cov2 = c(15,17,30,28,41,43,71,74,80,88),
 rsv = c(14,16,29,27,40,42,70,73,79,87),
 flu_a = c(13,15,28,26,39,41,69,72,78,86),
 flu_b = c(12,14,27,25,38,40,68,71,77,85))

weekly_phrdw_data <- get_weekly_phrdw(phrdw_data)

get_weekly_phrdw_by_type_date_age(
                             weekly_phrdw_data = weekly_phrdw_data,
                             type='rsv',
                             start_date='2022-10-01',
                             end_date='2022-11-01',
                             start_age=0,
                             end_age=10)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 2
#>   date       confirm
#>   <date>       <dbl>
#> 1 2022-10-02      30
#> 2 2022-10-09      56
#> 3 2022-10-16      82
#> 4 2022-10-23     143
#> 5 2022-10-30     166
